titleStmt.title: Samuel G. Suddarth, Receipt to John B. Lindsey
CWG13776

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.idno: QMG Box 10; Folder 1864 Clothing, Camp & Garrison Equipage, Telegraph Expenses, Some Claim Letters; Bundle 1

body.p:
No. 22.
The State of Kentucky,
To John. B. Lindsey Dr.

row.cell: To Services rendered in assisting in the organization of the Enrolled Militia

body.p: Approved, and the Q. M. Genl is Ordered to pay the Same out of the Militia fund.
I certify that the above account is correct and just; that the services were rendered as stated; and that they were necessary for the public service.

D W Lindsey
Inspector Quarter-Master Gen. Ky.

Received at Frankfort, Kentucky, the 30 of July 1864, of S. G. SUDDARTH, Quarter-master General of Kentucky Volunteers, the sum of Eighty Three Dollars and Thirty Three Cents, in full of the above account.

No. 22.
The State of Kentucky,
To John. B. Lindsey Dr.

row.cell: To Services rendered in assisting in the organization of the Enrolled Militia

body.p: Approved. And the Q. M. Genl. is Ordered to pay the Same out of the Militia fund.
I certify that the above account is correct and just; that the services were rendered as stated; and that they were necessary for the public service.

D W Lindsey
Inspector Quarter-Master Gen. Ky.

Received at Frankfort, Kentucky, the 30th of July 1864, of S. G. SUDDARTH, Quarter-master General of Kentucky Volunteers, the sum of Eighty Three Dollars and thirty three Cents, in full of the above account.

No. 22.
No. Abstract B Qr. 186.
John B. Lindsey
Dollars 83.33/100
Paid July 30th, 1864.
14
